etymologies: 1930s (in an earlier sense). From an- + elastic

definitions: Of or relating to deformation of a material in which strain is not simply a function of stress and which is such that the material will return to its original shape once the load is removed. Also: designating deformation of this kind, or a material that undergoes such deformation. Compare "elastic", "inelastic".

notes.text: Whereas in elastic deformation stress is proportional to strain, in anelastic deformation the rate of increase in stress is also partly dependent on time.
